properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A band of heavy rain will continue to affect areas near the Caribou Mountains. Additional rainfall amounts of 30 to 50 mm can be expected tonight with an another 5 to 10 mm Tuesday morning. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T19:13:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T03:14:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3640050073.2020
Area: Mackenzie Co. near Bistcho Lake, Mackenzie Co. near Rainbow Lake Zama Lake and Chateh, Mackenzie Co. near Zama City, Mackenzie Co. near Indian Cabins and Steen River, Mackenzie Co. near Meander River and Lutose, Mackenzie Co. near High Level and Bushe River Res., Co. of Northern Lights near Paddle Prairie Smt, Mackenzie Co. near the Caribou Mountains, Mackenzie Co. near Fort Vermilion, Mackenzie Co. near John D'or Prairie and Fox Lake, Mackenzie Co. near La CrÃªte and Buffalo Head Prairie, Mackenzie Co. near the Tallcree and Wadlin Lake Reserves
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms tracking eastward from Manitoba are possible this evening and the threat continues overnight. Wind gusts near 100 kilometres per hour are possible. Heavy rain with thunderstorms giving up to 50 millimeters within an hour are also possible. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-14T08:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T05:25:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3695296961.2020
Area: Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h. At 10:30 PM CDT Doppler RADAR indicated that this line of severe thunderstorms stretched from Brokenhead to east of Libau and was moving toward the east at 60 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-07-14T06:21:46-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T03:33:46-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2316726774.2020
Area: R.M. of St. Clements incl. Grand Beach Brokenhead and Libau, R.M. of Brokenhead incl. Beausejour and Garson, R.M. of Alexander incl. Powerview-Pine Falls, R.M. of Lac Du Bonnet
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing wind gusts in excess of 90 km/h. At 11:00 PM CDT Doppler RADAR indicated that this line of severe thunderstorms was about 20 km northwest of Lac du Bonnet and was moving toward the east at 60 km/h. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:33 p.m. CDT (11:33 p.m. EST, 12:33 a.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-14T07:31:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T04:33:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1806866742.2020

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. 40 to 60 mm of rain can be expected tonight and into Tuesday morning with the possibility of some localities seeing over 90 mm. The rain is expected to end Tuesday afternoon. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NTStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-14T19:13:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T03:14:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1427282874.2020
Area: Hay River Region including Enterprise
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 12:59 a.m. EST (1:59 a.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from Muskeg Lake to Watap Lake, moving east at 60 km/h. Hazards: Wind gusts up to 100 kilometres per hour Rainfall rates of 50 millimeters per hour Hail 2 to 3 centimetres in diameter associated with the strongest thunderstorms Locations impacted include: Arrow Lake Provincial Park, Whitefish Lake, Silver Falls Provincial Park, Arrow Lake, Remicks, Moose Lake, Mackies, Shebandowan, North Fowl Lake, Whitefish Lake, Raith, Nolalu and Sunshine. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-14T08:57:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-14T06:00:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0799635115.2020
Area: Upsala - Raith, Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park, Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 11:35 p.m. EST (12:35 a.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of severe thunderstorms is located from Melema Lake to Basswood Lake, moving east at 65 km/h. Hazards: Wind gusts up to 100 kilometres per hour Rainfall rates of 50 millimeters per hour Hail 2 to 3 centimetres in diameter associated with the strongest thunderstorms Locations impacted include: Quetico, Keats Lake, Shelley Lake, Knife Lake, Kawnipi Lake, Kawene, Eva Lake, Knife Lake, Mercutio Lake, Crooked Pine Lake, McKenzie Lake and Saganagons Lake. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes.
Expires: 2020-07-14T07:32:40-00:00
